alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; McClain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 4:27AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Garvin, southern Grady, southeastern Caddo, southeastern Cleveland and McClain Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 426 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Tabler to 4 miles southeast of Chickasha to near Cement. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chickasha, Blanchard, Purcell, Slaughterville, Lindsay, Lexington, Maysville, Cyril, Dibble, Wayne, Washington, Cole, Alex, Cement, Amber, Norge, Bradley, Tabler, Agawam, and Criner. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 82 and 100. Interstate 44 between mile markers 66 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Severe weather is not expected and no warnings are anticipated at this time. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
